adrFormatAddress: 247 W 37th St 5th Floor, New York, NY 10018, USA

originalText.text:
Not your grandfather’s and great grandfather’s Jewish fraternal support organization. The Workmen’s Circle used to have awesome reduced cost medical services and subsidized burial plot/services programs. Two of my own grandparents are buried in Workmen’s Circle provided plots. But, not relevant today.
Today, Workers Circle’s primary focus is on learning Yiddish and standard woke social justice warrior causes.  Personally, I really miss their burial society membership. Truthfully, I just do not see any practical benefits for being a member today.  Yeah, I still subscribe to The Forward for its solid journalism; but, Workers’ Circle today is not a mainstream Jewish community organization. Today, the organization is primarily for (small number) of peripheral, leftist, non-conventional, mostly anti-Zionist Jews. The organization is really just a shadow of what it used to be.

originalText.text:
The most difficult Rehab and care center, to find out if your family member or friend is still admitted there. I spent almost half an hour trying but kept being put on hold, then being switched to an answering machine or the call being answered and the answerer transferring me to the said machine.
After being sent to the machine for about 5 times, I finally quit.
Is there an extension to Pt. Information? Or can someone else be cross-trained to provide such an invaluable service?

originalText.text: I love this place! Right now they have a drive to make teens conscience and sign them up for what ever Social Justice issues they feel passionate about! Now is the time to stand up for something, behind something and change something. There's power and strength in numbers. United we stand, divided we fall.

originalText.text: Will not return calls when messages are left .and puts corona patents in the same room. No chance for recovery.

originalText.text: Always a joy to be here, whether it be the awesome yiddish classes or the fantastic staff :)
